thread.title: Soap spoilers: EastEnders proposal, Hollyoaks killer latest, Emmerdale revenge, Coronation Street confession - EastEnders Soaps -
thread.title_full: Soap spoilers: EastEnders proposal, Hollyoaks killer latest, Emmerdale revenge, Coronation Street confession - EastEnders News - Soaps - Digital Spy

author: Daniel Kilkelly
title: Soap spoilers: EastEnders proposal, Hollyoaks killer latest, Emmerdale revenge, Coronation Street confession - EastEnders Soaps -
text: Here's a first look at Halloween on EastEnders as Martin Fowler shocks Stacey Branning by going down on one knee.Upcoming episodes will see Martin (James Bye) decide that it's time to make a full commitment to Stacey, wanting to settle down with her now that his split from Sonia has been finalised.The market trader initially confides in his friend Kush Kazemi by revealing that he's planning to propose, but the surprise element is ruined when Stacey (Lacey Turner) finds the engagement ring hidden away in a toolbox.A nervous Stacey quickly turns to Whitney Dean (Shona McGarty) for advice and admits that she doesn't want to get married again. © BBCStacey finds Martin's engagement ring © BBCStacey tells Whitney she can't marry Martin Ultimately realising that honesty is the best policy, Stacey then stops Martin in his tracks by insisting that things should stay as they are - leaving him crushed.However, as Martin's romantic proposal plans are already in place, he later decides to go ahead regardless by surprising Stacey as she hosts a Halloween party on the Square.Martin pops the question in his own unique way and it's not long before the proposal takes a very odd turn. Is everything as it seems, and how will Stacey react? © BBCMartin proposes to Stacey © BBCMartin proposes to Stacey but what will she say? EastEnders airs these scenes in an hour-long Halloween special on Friday, October 30 at 7.30pm on BBC One.EastEnders gets hour-long special as Halloween hits Albert SquareEastEnders boss Dominic Treadwell-Collins: 'Stacey's baby may not be Martin's'EastEnders spoilers: Newcomer Kyle befriends Stacey in on-location filming picturesEastEnders spoilers: Kat and Alfie Moon will return to Walford this ChristmasRead more EastEnders spoilers and newsOver on Hollyoaks, little Charlie Dean's behaviour will become a cause for concern after he witnesses something shocking.Charlie (Charlie Behan) gets a scare next week as he spots the Gloved Hand Killer injecting one of their targets at Hollyoaks Pride.The cheeky schoolboy could even discover the killer's identity after seeing the Gloved Hand lift their mask while taunting their latest victim.In the aftermath of the sinister moment, Charlie starts having nightmares about what he saw at Pride and also starts drawing some disturbing pictures. © Lime PicturesCharlie starts drawing strange pictures © Lime PicturesDarren is worried about Charlie When Nancy (Jessica Fox) and Darren Osborne (Ashley Taylor Dawson) spot the sinister sketches, they decide to call in a doctor to check that everything is okay.Charlie later draws another picture and Darren is stunned when he sees that it's supposed to be a dead body. Has witnessing the Gloved Hand's crime had a lasting impact on Charlie, and will he hold the key to ending the villain's reign of terror? © Lime PicturesNancy and Darren talk © Lime PicturesDarren and Nancy talk about Charlie Hollyoaks airs these scenes on Wednesday, October 28 at 6.30pm on Channel 4.Hollyoaks 20th anniversary spoilers: The Gloved Hand Killer will strike three timesHollyoaks 20th anniversary spoilers: Will little Charlie Dean uncover the Gloved Hand Killer's identity?Hollyoaks 20th anniversary spoilers: Disaster will strike at Tony's Pride eventHollyoaks 20th anniversary: The Gloved Hand Killer's latest victim has been revealedHollyoaks releases action-packed new trailer for 20th anniversary week dramaHollyoaks star Daisy Wood-Davis: 'Gloved Hand Killer reveal is a real surprise'Hollyoaks favourite Jeff Rawle on Gloved Hand Killer plot: 'Maybe Silas should return'Read more Hollyoaks spoilers and newsComing up on Emmerdale, Ross Barton returns with a bang as he reignites his dangerous feud with his brother Pete.Ross (Michael Parr) is still out for revenge when he returns to the village after some time away, so he confronts Pete with a baseball bat at the caravan and knocks him unconscious. © ITVRoss hits Pete with a baseball bat © ITVRoss hits Pete with a baseball bat When Pete (Anthony Quinlan) regains consciousness again, he is shocked to find that he is hanging perilously from a high viaduct.Menacing Ross has attached Pete to a winch and has full control over his fate, leaving him calling all the shots.Ross orders Pete to leave a suicide message for James before jumping off the viaduct, but he's surprised when his defeated brother agrees to his sinister demands.After apologising to Ross and saying he loves him, Pete starts typing an emotional message to James into his phone. Can Ross really go ahead with pushing his brother to suicide?Emmerdale airs these scenes on Monday, October 26 at 7pm on ITV.Emmerdale and Michael Parr storm the Inside Soap AwardsEmmerdale's Michael Parr admits nerves over producer change: 'It's terrifying'Read more Emmerdale spoilers and newsMeanwhile, Coronation Street's Alya Nazir will decide that it's time to come clean as her guilt becomes impossible to bear.Alya (Sair Khan) has spent the past few months keeping quiet about how she cheated on her boyfriend Gary Windass by having a one-night stand with Jason Grimshaw.As the couple continue to make plans for their wedding, Alya is surprised when the Nazirs decide to make Gary (Mikey North) a partner in the gym - cementing his place within the family. Gary is delighted by the touching gesture, but it just leaves Alya feeling more guilty than ever. Things get even worse when Yasmeen suggests that Alya could wear her late mum's wedding dress on her big day, while Gary decides that Jason should be best man at the ceremony.Realising that she's living a lie, Alya breaks down at home and tells Gary that she drunkenly had sex with someone else when she was grieving for her dad a few months ago. © ITVAlya decides to tell Gary the truth © ITVAlya breaks down As Yasmeen, Sharif and Zeedan head home later, they're shocked to see Alya in floods of tears being pursued by an angry Gary, who is demanding to know who the other man was. The Nazirs are shocked by Alya's behaviour, while Gary focuses his angry attentions on Aidan Connor when he suspects that he was the mystery guy in question. With Aidan wrongly accused, will Jason step up and admit that it was him?Coronation Street airs these scenes on Thursday, October 29 at 8pm and Friday, October 30 at 7pm on ITV.Coronation Street's Catherine Tyldesley confirms Eva and Aidan spark: 'I'm spoiled for choice'Coronation Street's Ryan Thomas is quitting the soap: 'It's been a great privilege to be in Corrie'Read more Coronation Street spoilers and newsOver on Doctors, Valerie Pitman makes another return to The Mill to help out on the reception desk once again.When Valerie (Sarah Moyle) makes a memorable entrance at the practice, it's clear to Mrs Tembe and Heston Carter that she hasn't changed a bit.Valerie spends her first morning badgering patients and promoting herself as a medical sales representative.While most of the regular staff are well used to Valerie's antics, there's an awkward misunderstanding with newcomer Sid Vere as he hasn't met her before.The pair come face-to-face in the nurses' cupboard, but Valerie reckons that Sid is a thief looking for drugs. Sid is also taken aback, assuming that her strange demeanour means that she's a patient in need of psychiatric help. Will their working relationship improve after getting off on the wrong foot? © BBCValerie returns Doctors airs these scenes on Tuesday, October 27 at 1.45pm on BBC One.Read more Doctors spoilers and newsHollyoaks was the winner of our storyline poll last week as 46% of you chose the Roscoes' white water stunt as the best plot.Emmerdale was second with 26% for Cain's plan to kill Robert, while EastEnders was third with 20% for the latest drama surrounding Kathy's return.Coronation Street took fourth spot with 7% for Jamie's revenge porn threats, while Doctors had the remaining 1% for Emma's baby scare.Don't forget to vote in our poll below and let us know which storyline looks best this week!Digital Spy Soap Scoop video - hit play below for gossip on more Gloved Hand Killer deaths in Hollyoaks, the reveal of Robert Sugden's shooter in Emmerdale, a drastic decision from Kathy Beale in EastEnders and Alya Nazir's guilt spiralling out of control in Coronation Street. function onTemplateLoaded(experienceID) { bcExp = brightcove.getExperience(experienceID);
